page.title: 15CLYNE,A WELSH COMMUNITY - 1
page.content: Clyne is a{small community,}yet where houses and terraces do exist they are quite densely situated. The first housing you come to is a terrace on one side of the road. It is near a {railway bridge,}and is called Cyd Terrace. The rear gardens of the houses back onto small fields and also woodland. The village is on the side of the {B4434}road;it did have an old{tinworks at one time,but that was closed in {1940. The River Neath}flows below the village on the floor of the valley,as does the{Vale of Neath Canal. At one point near the village,the canal crossed the River Neath by means of an{Aqueduct.}However,most of this was carried away in a flood and the water is now piped across the river.
